FacilityName: Sysco Food Services of Grand Rapids, LLC

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Sysco Food Service of Grand Rapids is a general line grocery wholesaler located at 3700 Sysco Court SE, Grand Rapids, MI. Anhydrous Ammonia is used as a refrigerant at this facility to maintain perishable and frozen product.

The refrigeration system at the Grand Rapids facility is a two-stage, closed loop system with normal operating pressures that range between a low side pressure of 0 psig to a high side pressure of 165 psig. The maximum amount of ammonia in the system at any one time has been calculated at 15, 000 pounds.

Accidental Release and Emergency Response Policies:

Sysco Food Service of Grand Rapids has established a trained, in-house emergency response team to quickly respond to and handle releases of anhydrous ammonia. Training for emergency responders is based on the guidelines set forth by OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.120 (HAZWOPER). The facility has also established annual refresher training for all personnel on the HAZMAT Team as well as periodic spill drills and plant-wide evacuation drills to assure all employees are prepared in the event of an emergency. Emergency response plans have been coordinated with the Kent County LEPC to establish a joint response program. These plans and procedures are periodically reviewed to assure that they are current and up to date.

Emergency Response Program:

Sysco Food Service of Grand Rapids has developed a written Emergency Response Plan and trained the refrigeration operators and selected plant personnel in emergency response to hazardous chemical releases. The trained personnel are expected to assess each release situation and determine the appropriate emergency response to initiate. This could be simply tightening a packing nut or flange bolt to initiating a system shutdown. Standard Operating Procedures have been developed for the operation of the ammonia refrigeration system including procedures for the emergency shutdown and isolation of equipment should a release occur. This facility has also purchased

Level A protective clothing, self contained breathing apparatus (SCBA) and other appropriate protective equipment to support the in-house HAZMAT team. Emergency response assistance is coordinated with local emergency agencies and the Kent County LEPC.

Five-Year Accident History:
There have been no reportable accidental ammonia releases within the past five years.

General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps:

Sysco Food Service has developed and implemented a Process Safety Management (PSM) program to insure the ammonia refrigeration system is maintained in a safe and efficient manner and facility employees are properly trained in the safe operation of this system. In addition the facility follows the following codes, standards and guidelines to maintain the mechanical integrity of the covered process:

International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration (IIAR) guidelines for Ammonia Refrigeration
ASHRAE Safety Code for Mechanical Refrigeration
ANSI/IIAR 2-1999 Equipment, Design, and Installation of Ammonia Mechanical Refrigerating Systems
ANSI B31.3 Piping Code
NFPA Guidelines for Fire Protection Equipment

Through regular audits, training, maintenance, and testing and inspection programs, Sysco Food Service of Grand Rapids has established a history of safe operation, community emergency action plans are current and training with community services is conducted for a safe response in the event of an accidental release.
